concept.title: What is the Lexis Advance® bill tracking?

ph.#tail: consists of two main tools, the Progress Bar, and the Legislative Outlook.

p: The Progress Bar provides a graphic representation of the progress of a state or Federal bill in the legislative process that appears on a bill text and bill track document. It provides an at-a-glance view of the current progress of a bill.

The Legislative Outlook is a feature that displays a statistical analysis of a bill’s probability of passage to the next stage of the legislative process.  This is indicated on a bill text or track document by an icon that displays one of the following states:

uicontrol.#tail: to see additional political intelligence regarding the factors that impact a bill’s movement. This detail includes:

li: Low chance to pass next stage
Medium chance to pass next stage
High chance to pass next stage
Current status of the bill's progress
Statistical probability of passage for each stage of the legislative process, by percentage
Current legislative session status (In session, Adjourned, No session, Session not convened)
Partisan makeup of each legislative chamber
Bill sponsor's name, party association, and seniority
Bill sponsor's legislative success rate from the previous session
Bill sponsor’s legislative success rate compared to the success rate of his or her party and chamber
